action.primary: Dissipates Blood Stasis and breaks up Stagnation, tonifies the Spleen and promotes diuresis

indications: Scrofula, sores and boils, stomachache, abdominal masses, abdominal distension, poor appetite, ascites, acute conjunctivitis

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Deficiency Cold in Spleen and Stomach.

notes: This herb is used as a powder, made into a paste or soaked in wine.
this herb has been shown to inhibit the growth of cancer cells.
This herb is said to cure abdominal masses in children and other chronic and uterine masses.
The herb Hb. Polygoni Orientalis Hong Cao, is said to quench thirst, relieve fever, improve vision and promote the flow of Qi.

For abdominal masses, stew to a paste one bowl of the fruit or flower of this herb into a paste and apply to the mass or mix with wine for oral administration. Greasy food is forbidden while taking this herb.
